38793793.review:
Ok, as a preface, I am a lesbian and am very starved for a good yuri VN since I play most of them I can get my hands on. 

The story is about two sisters who fall for each other the second they first lay eyes on the other, albeit before they know they're sisters. Through varying circumstances the protag and her love interest do fall for each other while maintaining the ideal that they're just growing as siblings. Turns out they actually love each other and wham bam thank you ma'am everything seems to be going for them. Then Incest Happens (with added social bad points in them being gay) and the real world rammifications of it hit hard and sh*t starts happening that really shows off how well the characters are written. It's not a fetish bait (at least not entirely without the h patch, save a few scenes) and the characters act pretty believably all things considered. The dialogue is a bit wonky here and there but overall it's solid. This game one isn't very long however I do give it a reccomend if you don't find the topic matter too revolting. 

The only major gripe I had was a major plot point later on in which ~*SPOILERS*~ [spoiler] the love interest says that incest is illegal. That felt like a cheap ploy to make the weight of the situation feel that much more effective while in reality it's not necessarily illegal in Japan and the feeling of weight could have been directed moreso at the social impact it could have had on their relationship. [/spoiler]

38774252.review:
时间跳回到九十年代，《同级生2》中的义妹鸣泽唯想必给不少人留下了深刻印象，这是许多老玩家的妹控启蒙作之一。在上世纪之交时，与《Canon》发音相似的《Kana: Imouto》横空出世，作为泣作代表，实妹加奈让不少人留下了感动的泪水。不过《Kana: Imouto》中更为侧重描绘兄妹间的血缘亲情，而非恋爱。之后包括《初音岛》等作品不断兴起，直到《缘之空》开始和伦理制度正面角逐。缘之空中的春日野穹也是男主角的实妹，而其作为可攻略对象在当时引起了极大的社会争议。

[h1]禁忌之恋[/h1]

本作也力图描述禁忌之恋，不过其并非兄妹，而是姐妹。尽管在GALGAME界，姐妹百合元素并非只此一家，但是对于steam平台而言，其还是显得十分稀有。本作描写了两位从小便分别的一对姐妹在经历若干年后第一次在人海中相遇，之后她们在父亲的授意安排下鬼使神差地住进了同一所公寓。故事就此展开，她们是止步于姐妹呢？还是说会发展成为一段禁忌的乱伦之恋？尽管《Love Ribbon》杂糅的元素颇具魅宅之嫌，不过还是让人由衷期待它会以怎样的处理方式来表现这段感情以及如何处理这种禁忌。

许多作品都会委婉地使用包括领养，义妹或者是血缘关系较远的同族姐妹来模糊视听，伪装成实妹可攻略向作品，一方面是为了规避软伦，另外一方面也弱化自己作品本身充斥的矛盾，从而使得自己更能得心应手处理剧情。不过，这样却有些挂羊头卖狗肉之嫌。《Love Ribbon》并没有避实就虚，没有大家厌恶的恶俗桥段，所以可以放心食用。

[h1]人物塑造，以下情节含有剧透[/h1]

故事主要涉及四个人物，撇去并没有立绘教授不谈。先来说说看两个主要角色。姐姐和妹妹的人物塑造在同类型游戏中较为脸谱化，通过发色大家便可以简单分辨出人物和大体的性格特征。姐姐是没头脑的傻白甜，当然，这里的傻并非指智商，姐姐在学院的成绩异常优秀，剧情中也正是因为这段感情而导致了姐姐的成绩下滑，从而被教授盯上。“傻”指的是女主角体贴温柔善良的为人处事性格，在最初面对较无理且有些粗鲁的妹妹时，依然能不发脾气。在面对爱情时，姐姐的态度不卑不亢，能够坦白真诚地说出自己的爱意以及顾虑。在面对争吵时，她会说出：“我不知道你到底怎么想的，你是喜欢我还是恨我？我是你的姐姐还是你爱慕的对象？我唯一想知道的是我们在朝着什么方向发展。”由此可见，她并不是如同妹妹所说的被宠坏的小孩，而是落落大方，具备姐姐的责任感。而姐姐缺乏的是独立自主，她是黑暗料理能手，她就像生活中的大多人一样，冷淡而又沉默，随波逐流，找不到自己的方向，需要一个强有力的人来指引她接下来的路该怎么走。而妹妹作为不高兴的黑长直，相较于姐姐，她反倒身材更加修长，活得更加自由自在，做事情也没有太多的顾虑。在感情问题中，往往由她来引发和制造矛盾和冲突，她会通过想要验血的方式来验证两人是否是亲姐妹，想要通过假装醉酒来诱惑姐姐。因为和姐姐截然不同的童年成长环境，使得她性格颇为孤高自傲。妹妹缺乏的是一个人的细心投入和全身心的爱，于她自己而言，在没有接触这个从出生开始之后就没见过的姐姐之前，她甚至不太明白爱为何物。两人性格互补，所以这出恋爱轻喜剧尤为打动人心。次要角色中，尽管父亲也一样没有立绘，但是他的角色尤为关键。他是最早闹剧的策划人以及最后给予姐妹最直接的情感支持者。对于现实生活中而言，他是一个极度理想化的游戏扁平角色。其出现单纯为剧情服务，愚以为，这样的人物塑造欠妥。你很有可能会像姐姐一样地感慨：“How can everything be okay,just like that？”

[h1]缺陷与不足[/h1]

故事整体而言偏向于轻喜剧，有许多场景令玩家印象深刻，比如说妹妹第一次出现在酒吧唱歌时，那一刻，不得不让人联想到《凉宫春日的忧郁》、《轻音》、《LoveLive！》等作品，配合上少量动画，让人眼前一亮。值得一提的是，每当两人关系有所进展时，便会出现动画，这种升维打击对逐渐在屏幕面前逐渐失去耐心的玩家尤为有效。相较于动画的出色，一些静态CG则非常让人出戏，甚至非常影响玩家的游戏体验。人脸的透视问题非常大，其中尤以妹妹的观感最差，斜站着且带有斜睨眼神的妹妹活脱脱就像比目鱼脸一般让人触目惊心，实在有损体验，最致命的是妹妹非常喜欢这个动作，不厌其烦地在暴露画师可能不懂人脸透视原理这个事实。作为一名普通玩家，我实在想不明白为何会出现这么大的纰漏。

在现实生活中，除开结婚生育等传统观念之外，许多时候，是面子上过不去。《喜宴》如是，《Saving Face》亦如是，《Love Ribbon》自然也不免俗，游戏中并没有逃避这一层矛盾，不过对于这类VN而言，毕竟讨好相应的受众群体才是最主要需要考虑的因素，因此更为沉重的话题感也就如同蜻蜓点水，一带而过。除此之外，《Love Ribbon》还需要帮助观众克服对于姐妹恋这份背德感的不适。私以为，其并没有很好地胜任工作。游戏可以有两个结局可供选择，事实上，由于设计不佳其实一般玩家如非刻意很难玩出坏结局。这使得《Love Ribbon》可以视为是一个大团圆合家欢聚的游戏，也使得其无论是在内容或者是在精神核心上都偏向于轻喜剧。

[h1]值得购买吗？[/h1]

既然如此，那么如果你是想简单体验下一场单纯的恋爱，并且不排斥姐妹百合这个噱头，那么可以考虑该作品。游戏时长大概在三到五小时左右，算是一款小品VN，游戏的文本量也不大，大概大学四级英语左右即可轻松应对。如果更希望在VN中寻求一种作者的表达欲望，那么建议谨慎选择。

另外，谢谢小溪的礼物。

[spoiler]评分：4/10[/spoiler]

38741992.review:
Vale cada segundo.
Arte linda, colorida de uma forma gostosa de olhar, os sprites das personagens e os backgrounds são muito bem feitos e se diferenciam muito de demais VN's.
A história de longe é o ponto mais forte do jogo, muito única e te faz ficar apreensivo com o que irá acontecer em seguida, se tratando de um tema taboo dificil de se falar. As personagens são bem "vivas" e demonstram sentimentos e ações realistas de um casal de verdade, como insegurança e nervosismo, discussões e etc.
O jogo  possui dois finais, sendo alterados por apenas uma escolha, sendo as  outras somente para liberar diálogos diferentes, mas por incrivel que pareça isso não me deixou encomodada pois elas levam a cenas únicas ou a pular elas.
Os desenvolvedores  disponibilizam um patch +18 para o jogo de graça, assim como o "Afterstory" (caso esteja bugado como no meu caso, que não me deixou pegar a conquista "Together" até eu baixar o patch manualmente), que mostra a história em um ano após o  "Good Ending".
Recomendo muito, nova VN favorita, não é cara e vale muito a pena, 10/10.

38620068.review:
Great story, great game. 9/10

That's what I was thinking while playing this. Up until a certain point very close to the end the only reason I wouldn't have said 10/10 was the limited character expressions, poses and backgrounds but as I said the storys intensity was remarkable and little could tarnish that...

Up until a certain point. FAIR WARNING SPOILERS BELOW!

Now throughout the story, Zoey had distanced herself from both her feelings for Iris and Iris herself. That was fine, even after multiple instances it didn't feel repetitive. There was great development and insight in between and after. However the final time Zoey ran away when their father had appeared and explained Zoey was not coming back, this was where it went downhill, FAST. Obviously Iris is thrown in disarray, for the first time they both understood eachothers inner desires and both were in acceptance of their taboo but profound love. Through this confusing spiral of pain, disbelief and abandonment Iris becomes depressed. Overwhelmed by the tormenting thoughts of never seeing Zoey again Iris does... 

What? What do you dear reader think a person dragged through this would do? 

Forget about your only friend/sister/one true love?

Make new friends after NEVER having one prior?

Go out with said non-existant friends, have a laugh and pick up some hobbies?

Never mention that only friend/sister/lover and the large portion of your daily life. The one that consumed your every thought day and night?

Forget them with a little school and volunteer work when you LITERALLY COULD NOT KEEP them off your mind for entire days on end? Not to mention they lived with you all this time!

Well congratulations you're correct! That's exactly what they did, I mean seriously what else would you do other than let go of someone more significant than EVERYONE AND EVERYTHING INCLUDING YOUR VERY OWN FUTURE, at the drop of a hat. Oh but wait, what's this? Iris sees Zoey in a fleeting moment of pure chance and oh my god she's in love all over again and has to run after her and kiss her again because she's missed her this whole time! (despite NO mentioning)

Once again their reuniting goes as all the others have except this time when Zoey says she definetly won't leave again... She doesn't! 

You have to be joking right? Why after all of the great conflicts and final resolution would you turn around and senselessly shove another conflict in there? It had no reason. Right before the event was their final stand "the only way through this was to face the music, and I stand by that." Perfect climax, at the very least it would have made a great open ending as sometimes the best ending is none at all. If that doesn't suit you maybe put more than two bad endings in your games, I've read of others with the same complaint directed at your titles. No, instead you decide to beat the dead horse. Immediately after that event followed the running away for whatever reason *eyeroll* I think I've covered most of what was wrong with that. Now for the exciting conclusion! Just kidding, it was the same conclusion for the past conflicts aside from the what should have been the ending... 

Although this was way was better?

No. 

Had more meaning?

Try less.

I really can't wrap my head around why the developers did it but hey, that's my lengthy opinion. Excluding everything above I still love the game and glad I experienced most of it. Overall if anyone sees this while deciding to buy I would say 100% go for it! BUT if you feel like you may agree with my perspective, stop the game when Zoey asks: 

"So what do you say? Will you come with me or not?" and Iris hesitates with her reply making the screen display:

"......" That is where I quit as I feel that is the cliff edge. Hopefully me and anyone else who agrees can find a good fanfic or two eh?

38562660.review:
Is it okay for two siblings to be in love?

Love Ribbon is an important step in the right direction, within the yuri genre. One part of it is classic wish fulfillment, but at the same time it also succeeds as drama. Incest isn't just a silly gimmick here, it's serious business. The melodrama isn't the kind you'd find in Citrus, as the stakes are much higher, and the characters act much more naturally. Even with all that, there are plenty of moments of levity, and the tension is built up over time with patience.

The story is lacking in supporting cast, and the world feels a bit too railroaded. But, while we didn't learn as much about Iris and Zoe as I would have preferred, these two are charming people, they have great chemistry and their struggle feels real. I enjoyed this visual novel a lot, and it was more thought provoking than I expected.

38524514.review: I'm gonna get so much backlash from this, but i don't fucking care. never have i experienced a yuri visual novel like this one, and i've played a few. fuck it, i've rarely experienced such raw and genuine passion/desire between two characters from any of the visual novels i've played. some might think this perpetuates the idea that all things are solved through love, but i didn't feel like that was the case at all. also, if you recall, i stated in a previous review that incest can be done in a wholesome way(despite incest itself being the complete opposite), and that exact thing drives this entire plot and the romantic motives. I don't condone incestuous relations, but it makes for an interesting story element in this case. i was weak and won over, because, forget working towards something knowing that it's wrong, inevitably failing, or having all the support in the world; these girls are nothing but relatable(when considering their struggles, dumbass) and envoke so much sympathy/empathy. incest shouldn't be romanticized, nor should personal/internal struggles/conflicts be romanticized, but i can tell that behind it all, this is trying to say something more about lust vs love. not only that, but emphasizing just how powerful they can be, putting misconceptions to rest, and identifying factors outside of their influence(cause most of the time, incest is committed unintentionally, an individual could be compelled to engage in said acts due to something being wrong with them mentally, or the popular reason being traditional methods that have yet to die in modern times(people don't interbreed to preserve their lineage anymore, like come the fuck on!)) Yes there is so much controversy, but don't let it take away from the beautiful music, indisputable relationship, lessons, etc. that this game has to offer. (also, the 18+ patch really enhances it, just saying, it's easy to download)

38426797.review:
Two sisters separated—emotionally damaged through family circumstance—unite for the first time. Mutual romance soon blooms, and against all odds. To consider [i]Love Ribbon[/i] an unconventional love story is an obvious understatement.

That isn't necessarily a bad thing. While the dialog oft fails to feel natural in places, there's a strong narrative structure here to make up for it, tragic climax and final act the most satisfying by far.

Art? Decent enough, though more variety would have been appreciated. The music, however, is frequently bland and stock; out of place.

This is a flawed gem to say the least. For the open-minded hoping for a happy end after all the angst, I'd say [i]Love Ribbon[/i] is worth the marginal entry fee and time investment. Anyone else? Not so much.

[b]Rating:[/b] ★★★½

Love Ribbon is truly superb! It certainly tugs on the heartstrings, especially when one fully regards the girls' situation. The connection, as well as the struggles between the two is very realistic and full of meaning. Iris' and Zoey's imperfections and redeeming qualities make the viewers both relate to and admire them greatly. The music is delightful, interchanging between light and dark tones whenever the story demands it most, therefore adding onto the already immersive atmosphere with its melodious sound. The art is truly breathtaking, the colors, details, and character angles perfectly aligned and complementary to the overall story. The animation is beautiful as well as realistic, flowing smoothly all throughout. The dialogue is quite realistic, the deep moments successfully heavy hitting and the lighter moments both comical and heartwarming. 

I understand that my words may seem like repetitive rambling, but this is only because there can never be enough good things said about this game. It is truly too great for words. I certainly recommend Love Ribbon. It is a true masterpiece, unrivaled and perfect. <3

36547535.review:
I feel the need to preface this with my thoughts on the taboo topic of incest. In United States culture, incest is highly socially stigmatized. It could literally ruin your life for someone to discover that you committed incest. In other cultures -- much fewer cultures -- this is not the case and incest isn't seen quite as scandalous. Also, historically, it was much less scandalous, especially for royal families who wanted to keep their "blue blood" pure. From a sociological perspective, I've always thought incest was more interesting than disgusting. It only disgusts me to think about [b]myself[/b] committing incest, but [i]not when someone else does[/i]. Honestly, I don't quite understand why others are so offended by what other people do, particularly if it doesn't affect them or their lives in any way. Although, I have a theory that many people aren't as disgusted as they let others think they are. Especially those who go out of their way to make it known that they're disgusted. I think that's a bit obvious. If you go to a visual novel's community page and start going on about how much the game disgusts you, I'm just going to wonder who you're trying to convince. 

[b]The story is literally about two sisters who happen to fall in love with each other. Not stepsisters. Not even half-sisters. Full-blooded sisters fall in love and want to be with each other sexually and romantically.[/b]

The story raises a lot of questions about human sexuality. The two girls see each other in passing on the street, not knowing who they are (because of not growing up together), and find each other attractive immediately. This occurrence could literally happen to anyone and it has happened in real life to people. People who didn't know they had long, lost relatives that by some amazing twist of "fate" met each other and fell in love, only to find out that they were related later. The point being is that the repulsion to incest is not inherent, but taught via socialization. That's why it differs from culture to culture. Some cultures teach people to be extremely disgusted by incest, so people have aggressive negative reactions to it, lest you be judged and shunned for even remotely being "okay with it." 

The story is actually fairly well-written. Some dialogue could use some work (obviously, in my opinion); honestly, I was expecting more of an excuse for some taboo incest ecchi stuff, but there's a lot more to it than that. The romance is built up gradually and it most definitely elicits emotions. It's easy to empathize with their struggles, their pain, and even the romantic feelings. It turns out to not be some kind of fetish for them, but that they sincerely do love each other wholeheartedly. 

Yes, there's an 18+ patch for some yuri hentai, but even without it, the VN definitely has some risque scenes and suspenseful romance.

If you can get over the incest aspect, or dare I say "be okay with it," then I definitely recommend the visual novel. It was very captivating, interesting, and bittersweet.

36420617.review:
It's time for another review! 

This one is about Love Ribbon ( obviously lol ) which I already call one of the few gems out there in the Visual Novel genre. 

I wanna start with a rather negative look though. 

After I finished the game I read alot of the discussion threads and topics going around about this game and I really cannot understand why it recieves so much hatred. Yes it is a story about a taboo love between two sisters, but that is already stated in the games description anyways. So I don't get why people are so insulting and immature behaving on that topic. Like, if you have a problem with that setup then please stay away from that game rather than buying it and complain about the literal setup itself.  

Personally it was a really interesting expirience to read this story. Not only because it is really well written and easy to follow, but also because the point of view in this taboo zone is really interesting. From the different points inside the realitionship aswell as from the different points and angles on how it affects your surroundings. 
The taboo thing didn't only make it more exciting but also alot more emotional in my opinion. After all it's is not easy to deal with lover feelings for your own blood related sibling. From trying to work around the feelings, to the attempt to shut your feelings down completely, to finding a way out of this or of course, find a way for it to work. Every mind set was covered here and fleshed out perfectly in my opinion. Not only was I able to feel the hardship this whole setup brought with it but also the wish for it to work out and all that thanks to the amazing story writing which was done here. 

Graphic wise the game is gorgeous. From the backgrounds, to the characters, the colors and ofc the motion function which was built in in some of the important situations to make it more lively, I was really pleased with the amazing work of the creators. The only downside I wanna mention though is that the soundtrack got somewhat repetetive. Of course, like in every other Visual Novel, there is one tune for exciting stuff, one for emotional/sad stuff, a chill tune for everyday stuff etc etc. You get what I mean. But on this Visual Novel it felt repetetive quite fast. I cannot really say why or if the soundtrack actually lacks in variety but at least I got the feeling it does so. 

Overall it was an amazing expirience to read this Visual Novel. An astonishing story with so much emotion and in-depth details about mind settings and actual emotions of the characters that the story itself is something which could have been published without anything else to it. 

I definitely recommend this game for anyone who has no problem with this "incestous" story and is able to look past this "social" cutrain to expirience an amazing masterpiece of art and story! 

~ ShikiX

《Love Ribbon》是一款以禁斷百合姊妹花為題材的視覺小說遊戲，完整通關時數約5小時。綠光尚存的時候，某浠衝著Love Ribbon的畫風和百合兩點投票支持了，直到今天才通關實在慚愧（懶癌沒救了

兩女主是熱門“傻白甜”配高冷系的人設。拋開骨科要素，其實就一短篇百合的校園戀愛模板套路，當然兩人的感情進展少不了圍繞著血緣關係的糾結。作品整體完成度蠻高的，[h1]滿滿的糖，甜得膩人放心食用。[/h1]

值得一提的是Love Ribbon有官方補丁，一個是不可言說的補丁，另一個則是因原先GE結尾比較草率，所以開發商補了個After Story交代後續的故事。

35788858.review:
I've played a lot of games over the course of my life, and seen all manner of storylines, characters, and game mechanics. But even then, I'm pretty certain I've never come across yuri incest before... at least, until now.

Love Ribbon is not a game that takes that idea and plays it as some kind of weird fetish or as some big joke. It is taken quite seriously, brought up in a way that not only highlights that this is [i]very[/i] uncomfortable to most people (including the characters involved), illegal across the world, and yet also raises some questions about all that. The big question that this game seems to ask is "Yeah this is incredibly taboo, but is it 100% wrong in circumstances like this?" If the fact that our characters are (long separated) sisters wasn't here, this would just be another straightforward yuri love story like so many others.

Except that isn't entirely true, because LR doesn't just stand out for covering a controversial topic. The art is consistently good, the music works, but what surprised me was how well written this was. Much of the story isn't really about the yuri incest stuff, but rather about two siblings who have never met, or even knew about each other, in their entire lives suddenly having to deal with living together in an apartment/dorm for their school. Iris and Zoey also have very different personalities, and it is that which drives the plot the most. It's funny that I spent the first paragraph talking up how yuri incest was the major thing in this game, but in reality it is only really central to the plot in the last third of the story. Really, Love Ribbon is about two siblings trying to get along, figuring out how to deal with their new living situation, and then realizing that their growing relationship might be going too far and trying to work through that. 

The only two complaints I have is that first there was no voice acting. Though since this is actually not a Japanese VN, I'm actually ok with that due to the mixed quality of English voice acting. Second, it was too short. It took about 2 1/2 hours for me to finish the entire game and get all of the achievements. It actually made me sad because the truth is I was engaged and interested throughout the entire duration of the game. I wasn't just saying the writing in this is good just for the hell of it. If something manages to get me invested in the characters and feeling happy or sad along with them like this did, then that, to me, is a strong indicator that the authors are doing a good job. And with that kind of positive, the two issues I have with this game seem minor and unimportant.

So, Love Ribbon is a yuri game that deals with two sisters who have never met before suddenly living together, having to worry about how close they are becoming, and what the consequences of that closeness will be. The fact that incest is a main element of the story is probably enough to make people run away from this out of discomfort or disgust. But the truth is... they should not run away so quickly. Because if you decide to stick around long enough, as I did, to actually see what this game is, then you will be rewarded with a VN that is likely to exceed your expectations.

Now to play something that is likely quite mundane and less thought-provoking. >_>

35723448.review:
Pros/Cons as always

- STORY (don't expect Stephen King level of writing, but story is pretty solid and plot-heavy. It bring up a two taboo at once: Lesbian relationship (which is more or less accepted) and incest (which is rather unacceptable in most of the world). I won't discuss if it's morally wrong or not, but i was absorbed till the end),
- Visuals (background are really nice and characters are draws with soft lines and pastel colours. They are not that sharp like most JP VNs, but after a while i started to like this type of style),
- Music (nothing out of ordinary but in certain moments it help build up tension or loosen it),
- Yuri (story is about 2 girls loving each other, but despite some people thinking it's not an "porn game" [even if it have free H-rated patch]. I won't explain differences between "eroge" and "nukige", but basically story here is far more importatant than sex scenes).

- No Voice Acting (sadly both Zoey and Iris are silent while time. I would be glad to hear Voice Acting in this game, but absence of voice don't ruin the game),
- Mediocre lenght (game with additional Afterstory is around 2-3 hrs long so not too long for a Visual Novel)


Solid 7/10. I didn't expected much after not-JP Visual Novel, but i was really suprised how good story was. But i will say it again. It is an Eroge not a Nukige. Even if you can have a H-rated content with free patch, game is rather concentrated on story than your "relaxing"

35008714.review:
¿Harto de novelas yuris sin ningún elemento transgresor?, es decir la homosexualidad es gradualmente más aceptada y los romances prohibidos han dejado de serlo, así que, ¿cuál es el siguiente movimiento? pues el incesto, obvio, pero, por perturbador que suene, funciona, o al menos a esta obra le funcionó, todo de la mano de un buen desarrollo de personajes, junto a una historia creíble.

Técnicamente es lo habitual en una VN, diálogos, ilustraciones (tiene animaciones) y música de fondo, siendo este último sobresaliente, el OST me encantó, son pistas musicales que ambientan muy bien, destacando las composiciones con guitarra, aún así tiene fallos, como la interfaz que no logra contrastar bien los colores (al jugar con mando, cargo una partida que no quería), la carencia de nube (steam cloud), no poder grabar la partida (el juego parece ejecutarse en un limbo entre el escritorio y el directx) y por último la carencia de doblaje, una lástima.

En cuanto a la historia, somos Iris una chica que va a un prestigioso instituto, un día se cruza con una atractiva chica quedando intrigada por ella (cliché), al llegar a casa su padre la llama y le dice que tiene una nueva compañera de dormitorio llamada Zoey, (la chica que vió aquel día) y que es su hermana… sí, Iris no sabía que tenía una hermana. Al inicio no se llevan bien, aunque Iris trata de acercarse a Zoey, quien no cree que sean hermanas al menos no por completo.

[spoiler] Con esta premisa van ocurriendo varios sucesos que las acercan cada vez más, como que Iris ayude a Zoey a conseguir empleo como artista en bares, una noche el la que ebrias casi se besan, una noche de cine de terror donde Iris se asusta mucho y Zoey la invita a dormir con ella, situaciones en las que la trama sigue avanzando, llegando a ser amigas, para posteriormente ser algo más.

Todo parece ir bien pero, los deberes, el acoso de un profesor y las dudas de Zoey sobre el parentesco, comienza a crear una brecha entre las dos, Zoey se ve enfrentada a la realidad de una prueba de ADN que confirma que son hermanas de sangre, lo cual la aterroriza, al pensar en lo que han hecho, e Iris se ve enfrentada a que gracias al profesor su padre descubra su relación, además de perder la colegiatura, y aun así (si tomas las decisiones adecuadas) con tanto en contra, la fuerza de su amor es tanta que logran superar la adversidad y ser una linda pareja, algo que ni en Nurse love addition vi, y que me encanta.	[/spoiler]

En cuanto al estudio desarrollador debo decir que me encanta su actitud, el juego tiene escenas R18, que no se instalan en la descarga de steam (lógico), pero al abrir el juego hay un botón para que descargues el parche, otro desarrollador te oculta esos detalles o peor aun te cobra más, también agregaron una actualización que narra hechos un año después, la cual pudieron colar como DLC, pero no, fue gratis, y lo mejor es que el juego no es Japonés, por lo que no está sujeto a su estúpida ley de censura, por eso de que el sexo nos asusta más que la violencia.

Recomendada, si te gusta el género y si toleras o quieres un yuri algo diferente.

34869429.review:
[b]Love Ribbon is a touching yuri visual novel about an incestuous relationship between two sisters. The girls, who meet as strangers after not even knowing about each other’s existence for their whole lives, end up living and going to school together and after initial misunderstandings start developing feelings for each other. This leads to a rather deep and realistic story of forbidden love, that ends up happily, but never ignores the challenges and social stigma that comes with the protagonist’s choices.[/b]

It’s somewhat heavy on sexual themes, even without the 18+ content unlocked (I never installed the patch), but for me these elements never felt forced or distasteful – they always had an actual role in the narrative. The wording could be described as somewhat pornographic, but it never bothered me enough to actually feel out-of-place and the NSFW moments weren’t that numerous anyways, so they couldn’t overshadow the core story.

The game’s art and music are of high quality, just as I expected from the maker of Starlight Vega. The sprites (only the two main characters have any) and background aren’t that numerous or heavy on detail, but they’re pleasing to the eye and the CGs are all gorgeous (from what I’ve heard, that applies to the sexually explicit ones too). As the story is pretty short (around 7 hours for full playthrough) the characters aren’t extremely deep, but full focus on the main couple and their relationship helps it quite a bit. The protagonist, Iris, might seem a bit bland, but her thoughts and actions feel very realistic and the second sister, Zoey, is also above all a consistent character that starts as rather unlikeable and grows over time in slightly predictable, but still interesting and believable ways. 

The plot itself doesn’t always surprise you, but it feels sincere and well-written, so it easily brings the enjoyment and emotional impact this kind of story should deliver. [b]Especially with the expanded epilogue, it’s really a satisfying read that doesn’t try to force feelings out of you with some cheap tricks and doesn’t fetishize the subject matter to the point where it would be off-putting. Above all, it’s a really good love story that should be satisfying for all fans of yuri VNs or romance in general.[/b] 

While it’s somewhat short and light on player choices (and only one of them alone decides the ending), I can still wholeheartedly recommend it. Apart from the romance element, there’s also a bit of optional, high-quality erotic content for those interested – the game give you choice on how you want to experience it and I think it should be very much worth the asking price no matter which approach you take.

34842901.review:
The first VN game I've played outside of the Ace Attorney series, I stumbled across this while browsing the weekly sale listings and for whatever reason felt compelled to check it out. So glad I did.

This story is very well-written and had me hooked in from the moment I started. It tackles a taboo subject matter tastefully, and really brings you through a rollercoaster of emotions along with the girls.  Completion time will vary depending on reading speed of course, but it personally took me about 5 hours. I found myself feeling a little melancholy saying goodbye to Iris and Zoey at the end, but that's only a testament to the quality job Razz has done rather than an unsatisfying conclusion. The Afterstory epilogue update wrapped things up as perfectly as I could've hoped for.

In conclusion:

- Excellent story and characters that will stick with you.
- Great art style and music.
- A touching, maturely-handled romance that manages to be sexy without falling into raunchy territory.
-Good value. $9 is cheaper than a ticket to a 2 hour movie! 

So if you're here asking yourself if it's worth your time, I say "absolutely."

34569633.review:
Love Ribbon is an easy recommendation for anyone who wouldn't be immediately put off by yuri or OMG OMG OMG incest.  And it is refreshing to see a visual novel escape somewhat from the typical tropes of anime, both in writing style and the overall plot of the game.  The game shines most brilliantly during the times when main protagonist Iris is trying to figure out her sister Zoey's and her own feelings.  The overall pacing is slow but that pace is great when the sisters share an emotional moment with each other.
[list]
[*]The weakest facet of the entire visual novel is that the scenario is just not believable as a whole.  There are too many contrived elements regarding the setup that leaves the overall story in obvious fantasy or hokey territory.  Of course, plenty of visual novels contain fantastic elements, so why is this an issue with Love Ribbon?  It is because those other visual novels are clearly in the realm of fantasy, intended for escape and not to be taken seriously.  But in Love Ribbon, when one takes a look at the scenes and plot moments individually, those scenes and moments are totally believable.  They yearn the reader to take them seriously.  So the reader ends up in this bizarre world where the big picture is clearly surreal and incredulous, yet the moments that happen along the way--the intimate, small steps--are so convincing, lucid, and adorable.

[*]The writing makes it easy for the reader to care about Iris and her sister Zoey.  The sisters have conflicting yet complementary personalities, and the story makes good use of the contrast to make each of them special.  From a literary perspective, Iris is the weaker personality because she is the open-minded, socially awkward, hard working girl--the trite stereotype found in all too many anime and visual novel characters.  Zoey's personality is much more complex and interesting... but the way both work together is amazing.  They were meant for each other :)

[*]A strength of Love Ribbon is that the story is focused on just one heroine.  This isn't the "choose who you want" harem that is common for visual novels turned dating sims.  Because the story is focused on just one other heroine of interest, all of the moments with her become vivid and interesting.  The reader does not encounter story elements that looked interesting but end up fading into the background (because those elements are only significant for a path/heroine that the player did not end up choosing in other visual novels.)

[*]There are a relatively small number of decision points in this visual novel, but I found the decisions to have relatively little impact on the immediate plot.  Regardless of which choices are taken, the overall plot flows in roughly the same manner until the reader reaches an ending point.  This could be a positive or negative, depending on one's own expectations for visual novels.

[*]The overall story is somewhat short (at around six hours) compared to other visual novels, but this is not really a negative.  The length feels about right, in that there is a definite story and conclusion but without feeling like the plot just drags on and on.

[*]The music is nice but typical visual novel flair.  While not particularly noteworthy, the overall gentle theme is enjoyable and appropriate.

[*]An adult patch is available to enable sex scenes in the game.  However, those scenes are not really needed and may even detract from the romance.  Love Ribbon isn't really about sex, it is more about enjoying a story and adoring the characters.
[/list]

As sb who totally give no sh_t to all the social norms unfortunately I cannot experience the mental struggle of our protagonists very well. But the depiction of the characters is so well that I believe all of us can feel their agony. And even though I play quite a lot of yurigames I think it's been a long time since I get quite spiritually aroused. A-hem. It would be real nice if the story is longer or if we have more sequel....:P

P.S. Contrary to what so many people say, if you feel you cannot accept the incestuous subject.....I recommend you to play this. This may change your mind. Even if you don't, it's good if you start thinking WHY you dont.

33801745.review:
[h1] This game is probably [i] not [/i] for you if: [/h1]

[b]1. You are uncomfortable with incest themes. [/b]

The game revolves around two lesbian sisters and their hardships in trying to make their love work out. If you are uncomfortable in reading about incestuous relationships, then this is not the game for you.  

[b] 2. You want a game with mostly sexual scenes and some romance on the side. [/b]

This is not a primarily sexual game. The majority of the game deals with the main characters’ romance, which is very slow-paced and grows over time in a very realistic and understandable manner. There are only [spoiler] two [/spoiler] sex scenes; to get them, you must download the adult patch. The said scenes, however, are very nicely drawn. 


[h1] This game probably [i] is [/i] for you if: [/h1]

[b] 1. You want a long 8+ hour game. [/b]

I did not play the game on auto-mode because, since there is no voice-acting, it would be very irritating to wait for the text to change after having already read it or having not finished reading it. It took me about eight hours to finish the game, but depending on your reading speed it may be shorter or longer for you. 

[b] 2. You want a visual novel with choices based on one couple. [/b]

There is only one couple in this game; there are no character routes to choose from or a self-insert. However, there [i] are [/i] choices. Most of them do not change much except for some events, but there are a few that do change the course of the story drastically. There are different endings, [spoiler] a good and a bad one, that can be attained by making a different choice. [/spoiler]

[b] 3. You want an art style that is not too cutesy and not too mature. [/b]

The art in this game is not overwhelmingly cutesy and lolita-type, nor is it mature. It is a beautiful art style that shows skill. There are about [spoiler] seventeen [/spoiler] CGs (special full-screen images) in the game, and about [spoiler] seven or eight  [/spoiler] more if you had added the adult patch. You can tell a lot of effort was put into this game from how much beautiful content and art it has!

[b] 4. You want a game with an intricate, complex storyline. [/b]

As mentioned before, the romance between the two main characters grows at a very reasonable pace. Through experience and events, they gradually fall in love over time. The story is very realistic, as are the conflicts and hardships they face in their relationship. It is capable of moving one emotionally. It is a beautifully written story with lots of extra effort put into it! 


[h1] Other Points [/h1]

The menu is beautifully aesthetic and easy to use. There are options to change the volume of the sound and music, as well as options to skip the text in the story, play on auto-mode, and more. You can press the key “h” to hide the window. 

There is no voice-acting in the game at all, only text and dialogue to read from with music and images. However, the soundtrack is very nicely put together and fits the game from scene to scene. 


[h1] Opinions [/h1]
Most of everything under this subtitle is pure spoilers to the story and is not objective. 

I absolutely love the cover image! The art in general is so stunning and beautiful to look at; I could stare at it for hours! I have to say that out of any art I’ve seen before, the art in this game is definitely and without a doubt my favorite. The kiss scenes, the sex scenes, the hugging scenes – they’re all drawn so nicely! [spoiler] I especially think that Zoey is absolutely stunning, breath-taking, and drop-dead beautiful. Honestly, I couldn’t stop staring at her while playing the game, haha. [/spoiler]

I did not expect such a beautifully written story when I purchased the game, not to mention a very long one at that. 

I only found one thing silly in the game - [spoiler] how you get the bad end just because you miss one of Zoey’s concerts to take an extremely important test for college that you only have one chance to take. Of course, though, I wouldn’t have missed Zoey’s concert for the world! At that point in the game, I was completely and utterly in love with Zoey and Iris’s love! Haha! [/spoiler]

While it’s true that the story is serious at times, it also has some humor and lightness to it. It made me laugh when [spoiler] Zoey taught Iris how to chop potatoes, and Iris said “Alright, aaand… done! Phew, that was hard work.” and Zoey, in response, said “… You peeled a grand total of one potato.” [/spoiler]

I’ve only played two other lesbian games, and those were extremely fast-paced in the romance department. In this game, however, it was nothing like that. [spoiler] They got to know each other and slowly fell in love. There were a lot of teaser scenes where I thought they were going to kiss but didn't; in each and every one of those scenes, I was chanting “Kiss!” [/spoiler]

Nevertheless, I am very grateful that the romance develops as it does. It seemed so realistic and cute! [spoiler] All of the build-up of suspense melted away when Zoey finally kissed Iris on the table!
 [/spoiler]

I especially love the scene where [spoiler] Zoey takes out Iris on a date and says, “The truth is, when I got to the apartment, I was so nervous thinking about our date. Then I watched you from behind a tree for five minutes before I could muster the courage to come over...” and Iris replied with “I just want to spend time with you. You don’t have to wear anything new just to come see me… I like you just the way you are.” 

Then when they realized that they were in fact sisters and Zoey ran out on Iris, and Iris ran outside after her and dropped to her knees, crying in the pouring rain “Was it… really so wrong…?” I cried. I also cried when Iris hugged Zoey’s pillow, taking in her scent and her missing figure and crying, “It’s just not the same… Living here isn’t the same without you, Zoey.” [/spoiler]

The game is more than capable of moving you emotionally, as it really did emotionally wreck me in those solemn scenes. They were so beautifully written; I am planning on drawing them! 

[spoiler] When they reunited after that and kissed next to the bar, I was all but yelling “Yes!” I wanted nothing more than for them to be happy. 

I love the scene when they reunite after years and they walk off together, with the CG of them holding hands and saying “Together, then”. I was all but snorting when Zoey and Iris were switching clothes; it was super adorable to see.

I cried again when Iris called her father and told him about her relationship with Zoey, and how she started apologizing and sobbing hysterically – it truly moved me emotionally. 

The final CG is so adorable and my favorite! It made me laugh when Zoey was trying to take a selfie of her and Iris and Iris said “Alright, say “Yay camping!” and Zoey replied with “…At a resort hotel.” 

The icing on the cake was when Zoey sent the picture of them hugging to their father, and it slowly zoomed out on the picture and showed the said picture framed on their father’s wall in the mansion - perfect ending! [/spoiler]

I love the game so much, it was so good and I love the art so much! The [spoiler] final [/spoiler] CG is currently my wallpaper, even!


[h1] Conclusion [/h1] 

This game is truly a masterpiece, true to the word. Amazing art, story, romance, soundtrack - amazing game! 

It is definitely not worth only $10, I would pay $40 for this perfect game! I recommend it to anybody who enjoys lesbian romances and wants to read a cute, romantic, beautifully written and drawn story where love knows no bounds. 

I will definitely never ever forget this perfect game! I am [i] so [/i] happy that I happened to find it and purchase it! 

[i] [u] I give this game five stars out of five.

33507295.review:
Ну что ж, я наконец прошёл эту игру, и даже получил хорошую концовку, что для меня удивительно. Новелла не коротенькая, и если не читать её запоем, хватит довольно надолго.

Итак, главных героинь двое - это сёстры Айрис и Зои.

[b]Айрис[/b] - старшая сестра. От её имени ведётся повествование. Айрис - типичная пай-девочка, папенькина дочка. Она несколько инфантильна и иногда инертность её мышления начинает не на шутку бесить. Зато она прилежная, ответственная и хорошо учится. Завоевать сердце Айрис непросто, но уж если она призналась в чувствах, то будет безгранично верной, нежной и преданной.

[b]Зои[/b] - на год младше. Однако она выше Айрис ростом и выглядит взрослее. И это не только внешность. По контрасту с Айрис, Зои очень самостоятельна в жизни и суждениях. Она ставит свои увлечения выше учёбы, хотя умудряется при этом добиваться определённых успехов и в ней. В то же время, Зои способна жёстко себя ограничивать, если считает, что это необходимо.

Есть и второстепенные персонажи, но они представлены только текстом, без картинок. Впрочем, как и в большинстве подобных новелл.

[b]Папа[/b] - отец Айрис и Зои. Ещё до рождения Зои он развёлся и растил Айрис в одиночку. А Зои росла с матерью, но та не особо пеклась о ней, предпочтя сдать в интернат для девочек. В отличие от своей бывшей супруги, Папа - образцовый отец. Он очень любит Айрис и никогда её не ругает. Но есть вещи, которые даже ему трудно принять...

[b]Профессор[/b]. Зануда-профессор постоянно пытается наставить Айрис на путь истинный и заставить её учиться на отлично. Он терпеть не может Зои, считая, что та дурно влияет на Айрис. Профессор доставит нашим героиням массу неприятностей.

[b]Одноклассницы[/b]. Ну, одноклассницы и одноклассницы. Болтают за спиной, создают фон. Ни на что особо не влияют. Но понимания от них ждать не стоит.

Вкратце о сюжете. Сильно расписывать не буду, чтоб не наделать спойлеров. Две сестры выросли в разных семьях, никогда не видя друг друга и даже не зная друг о друге. И вдруг их переводят в одну старшую школу и селят в одном доме. Сёстрам предстоит преодолеть отчуждённость друг от друга и осознать себя как настоящие родственники. А может быть, и нечто большее, чем родственники... При этом то что они обе девушки никого не смущает кроме консервативного Профессора. Запад, как-никак, свобода нравов... Зато всех очень смущает, что они кровные родственники. Даже их самих. Собственно, проблемы с преодолением этого табу и составляют основную нить сюжета.

Мне новелла очень понравилась. Сюжет развивается очень драматично, и до конца не ясно, чем всё кончится. В аннотациях этой игры пишут "комедия", но назвать Love Ribbon комедией я никак не могу. Это драма. В ней больше трагичного, чем забавного. В довесок к отличному сюжету есть две масштабные хентайные сцены и масса романтики.

Lemme start off with... Love Ribbon has earned all of my love. 
And tears. 
'Cause, god, I cried.

So, speaking from the bottom of my heart: I saw the game (incest PLUS yuri? *starts singing 'sweet dreams are made of this'*) and what I expected was nowhere near what I found, but I mean it in the warmest way. 

How can I explain... I have played others, like our beautiful source of yuri hentai known as Sono Hanabira where girls have sex every five minutes 'cuz their gay asses won't know the word CHILL. Also played Kindred Spirits, which I loved with all my being bc REAL ROMANCE, something that Sono Hanabira series lacks deeply. Although it's the most complete (aka expensive) and I'd even dare to say that it's the ideal V.N, Kindred Spirits was lacking something too.

When I found Love Ribbon and started playing, I realized what it was. What was off. While I played, that vague feeling that something was missing every time I played a V.N finally came to an end. What was it, you ask. Well.

The gay drama.

If there's no drama or angst, I'm sorry to say this, but it's not really gay. It's just gay. Muggle gay. Not pure blood gay.

Ok, I'll hold me back right now and move on with the review *says 'I'm so sorry' in spanish* 

The story is well written, I loved every part of it (at least when I could read bc ya know there were some EYES in my TEARS) *shouts GAY DRAMA*

The developtment is amazingly good, gosh I can't even- 

The characters are, unfortunately, predictable, as speaking of their personality traits. Still, I enjoyed them all. The girls father was, indeed, the best.

In terms of Art, I have something to add first: This is a cheap V.N, so don't go on expecting different images every scene. In fact, I'd like to say that it might not be that perfect, but it just made Love Ribbon more unique for me. Oh, this game, golly- (where my supergirl and supercorp babies at)

Love Ribbon IS worth it, trust me. If you would just allow yourself to have the chance of crying over these useless lesbians, PLEASE, do it.

Love is love, guys. Keep that in mind, always.

INCEST IS WINCEST AND YURI SHALL CONQUER EARTH, now farewell.
'Till next Yuri V.N ♥ MADOKA BLESS Y'ALL

33350021.review:
What a truely beautiful visual novel~
Usually I am not a big fan of these types of "games". I said that in quotes, because, to me, visual novels are no games but more like a book and that is what they are actually intended to be and good at for the most part. And like a book of mine, I only crack one if the story is right. As big fan of romance novels and stories about forbidden love like Romeo and Juliet, I was bound to turn to this game eventually, and I did not regret buying it in the slightest.

The story is about the two sisters Iris and Zoey who, eventhough completly different in both character and way they got raised, soon find out their true feelings for each other. But just like in our real world, some kinds of relationships are shunned by the public. Having to hide their feelings, the relationship in front of not only the students but also their parents, you accompany them on their way through heartaches and eventually acceptance. It all depends on how you play the game. Every so often you get the chance to make choices that can have good or bad outcomes for the two sisters, eventhough the biggest of those decisions will eventually determine the ending. The game has two endings and an afterstory, which you may have to download seperately, but its not difficult it very easy to find in the discussion section of the game by the developers themselves.
Beautiful visuals, music and very nice character development will follow you through this heart wrenching story, aswell as some mild erotic features, which honestly are not really that explicit to begin with. Alternatively you can download a 18+ patch that unlocks two sexual scenes near the end of the aprox. 6-7 hour long story. It is obvious that the focus of the novel was more on the story than the sexual content, so if you are only considering buying this game for that, rather go somewhere else. If you however prefer a really bittersweet love story and you are a fan of forbidden love like me, you will love this game. I would really recommend giving it a try~!

-Blitzz

Abseits von AAA-Produktionen und Indieperlen hatte ich mal Lust auf etwas komplett Neues. Wie wärs mit einer Visual Novel aus Asien? Gesagt, gekauft. Steam Sale sei Dank.

Nun, die Geschichte ist etwas arg vorhersehbar, aber grundsätzlich nett geschrieben und überraschend herzergreifend. Die Figuren sehr klischeehaft, was allerdings niemanden überraschen dürfte. Dennoch hatte ich etwas mehr erwartet. Es ist im Prinzip eine Diashow. Der Hintergrund ist statisch und dann werden jeweils die beiden Figuren hineingesetzt, welche immer wieder die gleichen wenigen Posen einnehmen. Dazu gibs ein paar Musikstücke, die sich allesammt glänzend im Fahrstuhl eines Bürokomplexes machen würde. Die Figuren wurden nicht vertont und nur die beiden Schwestern gibs gezeichnet (und ganz selten auch animiert). Alle andere Figuren existieren nur als Text.

Aus meiner Sicht arg minimalistisch. Ein 08/15 Comic bietet mehr visuelle Abwechslung als diese VN. Es gibt verschiedene Entscheidungsmöglichkeiten, bei der sich aber nur eine einzige auf das Ende auswirkt. Chance vertan.

Eigentlich kein Titel, für welchen man eine Empfehlung aussprechen würde. Da die Geschichte aber interessant und unterhaltsam ist und sich einem Tabuthema unserer Gesellschaft annimmt, können Freunde dieser Art Software zugreifen. 

Wer will kann sich einen Ab-18-Patch ohne Problem im Hauptmenu downloaden und erhält zusätzlich ein paar wenige, überraschend explizite, weibliche Darstellungen... nun ja.

33134381.review: Une des meilleures VN que j'ai jamais lue (one of the best VN I have ever read). J'ai préféré réécrire mon évaluation en français. C'est très bien écrit, avec une grande économie de moyen, la partie écrite (récit) va très bien avec les images, la musique et les animations. On est pris dans l'histoire. Cette VN décrit comment deux jeunes femmes découvrent qu'elles sont soeurs seulement après leur première rencontre coup de foudre. Elles n'ont donc pas grandi ensemble. Cette histoire n'a rien de glauque, contrairement à ce que certains semblent croire. L'histoire décrit les contradictions dans lesquelles sont piégées les deux jeunes femmes, ainsi que la façon dont elles construisent leur relation amoureuse. Ce qui est touchant est la façon dont c'est décrit, avec beaucoup d'humour et en partant du quotidien le plus banal. L'interactivité est quasi-inexistante. Il y a quand même deux fins, une où les deux soeurs se séparent (c'est très éprouvant à lire :-)), et une où elles restent ensemble (celle qu'on se dépèche de lire si on a lu la première fin au risque de déprimer :-)).

33002290.review:
First things first: While I'm absolutely enamored by Zoey and Iris, their dad is my favorite character. Which really begs the question, what was this family's back story? 

Honestly, what isn't to love about this game? The story is sweet. The R-18 patch makes it sensual, but still in a sweetly intimate way. The visuals are flipping gorgeous and the music is lovely. The storyline is bittersweet and complex, and the beauty of the game is that it manages to disguise the depth and complexity of the topics contained in Love Ribbon.

The fact that they were sisters through me off, I'm not going to lie; that's partly the reason why I had to debate with myself for some time whether or not to purchase the game. But, love is love, and I respect that, so I decided to give the game a chance.

The game starts with this sort of "lull." The game begins the way most games of the genre begin, generic and not entirely convincing; but as the story unfolds (and with the addition of the after story), Iris and Zoey's storyline and characterization blossoms into something more organic and human. By the end of it, Zoey and Iris have become so vivid and alive. The story doesn't conclude in some ideal happily ever after, but remains bittersweet. You fall in love with them, or you fall into the same kind of acceptance the father eventually does (judging from the after story), or both. It's honestly very sweet, and thank the gods of gay I bought this game.

32857160.review:
I'll be honest, the reason I purchased Love Ribbon wasn't because I was expecting a well written story and characters (not that I'm without complaints on these two things) but rather for perhaps the more obvious reason - sister incest.

However, my perversions aside, I was pleasantly suprised by the engaging story that takes itself seriously and deals with the reprecussions of an incestuous relationship - both societally and mentally. And unless you go out of your way to patch the game, adding explicit content, the focus is way more on the inner struggles of the sisters and how they deal with their love for each other than it is on sex (Disclaimer: I haven't played without the patch. But I'm assuming that the two really explicit sex scenes are not in the unpatched version.) 

I also found myself attached to the characters. They're given attributes that make them feel more human, which in turn makes them relatable (in the sense that they have flaws, etc. Not saying everyone is going to relate to incest...). And as the story progesses, so to do the characters progress - change or become more open, etc. 

However, although I do praise the writing and characters, they both suffer from a flaw that usually keeps me away from a lot of visual novels - they're anime characters. That is to say, the main girl is your typical awkward, shy, quiet, studious, anime girl. A cliche. Now, they took the anime cliches and built on them, but they're still there and it still impacts the overall writing. This could just be my bias. But I'm bored of anime character cliches and I'm definitely tired of visual novels relying heavily on them. 

But with that said, I still really enjoyed Love Ribbon. This is an odd recommendation. Because I definitely recommend it, but the subject matter - incest - is rather taboo and could put people off easily. But if you're not completely disgusted just thinking about it, then even if you disagree with some of the points the game makes, you could still enjoy it overall. 

Now, if you see "Forbidden sister love" and think "ohhh interesting." Then I hold no reservations in my recommendations and you should buy it.

Edit: No one should feel apologies are needed for loving this. (sorry...but..steam awards)

32532957.review:
Я поведаю вам о самой умилительной визуальной новелле, что встретила на просторах стима. Досталась мне эта игра в подарок, и играть в неё я изначально не планировала, но после, скуки ради, я попробовала потратить часок-другой на её прохождение, о чем ни разу не пожалела. Даже более. Все 4 часа игры я провела в приподнятом и воодушевлённом настроении. 

Сюжет преподносит нам историю от лица главной героини - девушки, что является самой обыкновенной школьницей. Она красива, умна и живёт в состоятельной семье. Казалось бы, что еще нужно для счастья? Родительского контроля нет, никаких ограничений нет. Для полного счастья не хватает отвязной и несколько противположной личности, с которой наша главная героиня будет взаимодействовать на протяжении всей новеллы.  Варианты ответов, что даются игроку в течении всей игры, помогают настроить с ней дружеские, а после и любовные отношения. Да-да, именно любовные, подразумевающие в себе томные взгляды, походы на свидания, драматическую историю кровного родства и, в зависимости от выбора игрока, счастливого (либо же печального) финала. Это и является изюминкой данной игры, которая преподностится совершенно ненавязчиво.  В данной игре так же, помимо пропоганды женских взаимоотношений, присутствует ненавязчивый инцест,что не смущает, так как преподносится, опять же, постепенно.

Сюжет игры развивается не сразу. Он потихоньку преобретает обороты. Вариантов ответа у нас будет не так много, да и возможности часто содействовать в игре не предоставляется, но даже так общего впечатления игра не портит. 
Из существенных плюсов хочется выделить:
1.  Приятную для глаза рисовку. Моменты хорошо прорисованы, ну и конечно же не обошлось дело без анимации. Присутствует она не часто, но определённо радует глаз. Сцены плавненько анмируются, детализация фона на уровне, пресеты персонажей относительно хорошо детализируются.
2.  Местами слышно различного рода музыкальное сопровождение. Будь то сторонний шум, либо же приятная мелодия на гитаре.  
3.   В игре отсутствует русификатор, что не является плюсом, но при прохождении совершенно не ощущается отсутствие каких-либо языковых недопониманий, ибо достаточно средних образовательных знаний. Новелла довольно приветлива для русскоязычных пользователей, ибо события описываются понятно, а большая часть новеллы проходит в форме диалога. 
4.  Для ценителей откровенного контента, найдётся так же дополнительный для скачки патч с эротическим содержанием. Не сказала бы что он богат на какие-то откровенные сцены, но немного пикантной эротики, при жалении, можно лицезреть. 
5.  Ну и конечно же, в данной игре с приятной рисовкой платные фоны будут выглядеть эстетично и красиво.

Что касается минусов, то как таковых их нет. Конечно хотелось бы более долгой истории, но это уже на любителя. История милая, доступно преподносится, имеет интересный и не типичный сюжет. Персонажи неплохо проработаны, ну и атмосфера в общих чертах передаётся довольно хорошо.  
Советую к прохождению. Впечатления она оставляет неплохие, как для визуальной новеллы.

32296821.review:
Love Ribbon, eine VN über das Thema Liebe unter Geschwistern und die Probleme welche diese mit sich bringt.  

+ Zwei Enden
+ Ungewöhnliches Thema
+ Liebevoll inszenierte Geschichte
+ Schön gestaltete Charaktere und Hintergründe
+ Animierte Szenen (Auch die optionalen R18 Szenen sind animiert)
+ kostenloser R18 Patch
+ Stimmungsvolle Musik   
+ Bildergalerie
+ Verschiedene Entscheidungsmöglichkeiten.......

- ...von denen sich aber nur Eine auf das Ende auswirkt 
- Klischeehafte bzw. stereotypische Charaktere 


+- Nicht besonders lange Geschichte (Ich lese recht langsam und habe für die Geschichte +                  
      „Afterstory“ ca. 6 bis 7 Stunden gebraucht) 
+- Nur die beiden Hauptpersonen werden bildlich dargestellt, die Nebenrollen existieren nur als Text  


Love Ribbon ist sicherlich keine VN für jede Person. Wer jedoch offen gegenüber dem Genre yuri (Liebe zwischen Frauen) ist und sich auf eine Liebesgeschichte zwischen zwei Geschwistern einlassen kann, der bekommt mit Love Ribbon eine “dramatische“, “herzergreifende“ Geschichte, welche sich mit einem Tabuthema in unserer Gesellschaft auseinandersetzt.

32287565.review:
很聪明的一部作品.
是的我给了一款游戏"聪明"的评价.
用姐妹的噱头赚了不少关注, 卡牌成就H patch一个也没少, H patch下载链接还直接放在游戏主菜单上了.
画风比起这个组最初那部Starlight Vega也是好了不少.
玩家要什么就给了玩家什么, 所以我说这是一部聪明的游戏.
95%的好评率也很能说明这是个多么讨喜的游戏了.
在姐妹这个最关键的点上, 制作组也是聪明地打了个太极, 这俩人在游戏开始过后才认识, 说是"有血缘关系的陌生人"感觉比较合适.
所以剧情其实还是挺中规中矩的, 有点俗套.
玩过Starlight Vega的话, 你会发现其实他们能写出比这个规模更大更精彩的剧本来, 只是这回他们变聪明了.
写这么多也是因为我觉得有点失望和遗憾.

当然, 客观地谈游戏的综合质量, 本作还是很不错的, 一方面毕竟是西方制作组, 英文的行文还是很有保证的, 另一方面立绘CG啥的也都至少不算差了. 我要是因为剧本没有达到我的期待而打差评, 倒是很不厚道了.
总的来讲, 只要你对于剧本的精彩程度没什么执念的话, 本作还是很难让你失望的.

31783633.review:
**POSSIBLE MINOR SPOILERS, YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED**

--

Love is more important than anything else. Life is short, the heart wants what it wants, and if you deny yourself, if you bend to the will of people around you who just want you to be "normal" so their minds can be at ease, you'll just die miserable and alone. 

With that cheery sentiment clearing a path ahead, and having just finished the story a few minutes ago, I would like to say that "Love Ribbon" is now my favorite Visual Novel. Two girls fall in love with one another, and the story plays out with traditional ups and downs as that relationship attempts to move forward. 

Where the story gets its bite is in the details. Yes, there is the whole incest subtext that is actually brought up into the forefront many times in the story, but that shouldn't be the primary reason you purchase and play this game. The primary reason is that you're a hopeless romantic, that you love to see people fall in love, and that you're a firm believer in the heart getting what it wants as long as the parties involved are in full consensual agreement on the matter. 

Yes, the idea of incest is taboo, it's a taboo subject in many cultures, but then homosexuality was taboo in so many cultures. Just because it's taboo doesn't make it evil or wrong, just out of the box. Sometimes people can't cope with that, while others can. Navigating that minefield of who can and who can't certainly adds a sense of urgency and fear to this story.

I, for one, cheered the two protagonists onward, and for several reasons:

A) It ain't me
B) It's none of my damn business what they do, as long as both agree to it willingly.

Is there a serious misalignment of morality here? Eh, depends on how you define morality. If you don't like it, if you find it icky, don't do it. If you don't see the issue as a moral judgment, but rather an ethical judgment, you have more ground upon which to stand, but it all comes down to perspective. If, on the other hand, you're like me and just want people to be happy without the world kicking them into the dirt, you'll probably get the most enjoyment out of this story.

Still, the novel itself is well written, with a solid story, tight dialogue that gets to the heart of the narrative, and most important for some folks, it's visually sumptuous. Once again, Razzart just dominates with magnificent artwork. Anytime I read a VN with Razzart's work, I feel spoiled, and I know that even if the story is weak, the visuals will be stunning, and that is worth my time and money.

All in all, this story is, at its heart, about two people who love one another, regardless of what the world says about that love. Whether we find it right or wrong shouldn't matter, as we are not involved, we do not control their hearts, nor do we have the right to supercede the decisions they make between one another. With that said, now we get to the scoring:

Story: 10/10
Visuals: 10/10
Dialogue: 10/10
Adult Goodies: 11/10. Seriously. Read the novel. 

Summary Evaluation: Bought it. Loved it. Would buy again. If you're a romantic, buy the game and play it. I think you'll love it, too.

30583954.review:
Overall it's a short but enjoyable yuri VN. There is an 18+ patch on the developer's website, but most of the added content takes place later in the game, so you won't miss very much without it.

The major complaint I have is the choices you make throughout the game don't carry much weight individually. In fact, The VN only has two paths, of which is decided from a few (again) later game selections.

Most of the drama only takes place in the second half of the story. Until that point it's a mild "odd couple" meets "school girl" trope mash-up. Once the drama is stepped up, its enjoyable until the end. Over all it’s an enjoyable 3-4 hours.

Also, the bug the last scene on the third page of the extras is still there. It will remain locked no matter what you do. I spent far to long trying to unlock it before checking the forums.

30366625.review:
I came into this knowing nothing about Razz, or his other works.
I even had some of them on my wishlist, unknowingly!
However, after going through Love Ribbon.
I think I can safely say that this is a well written, well executed visual novel.
It isn't a tasteless, "made for the hentai," visual novel.
It has a great story, which is very well fleshed out, and has natural romance, besides the implication of incest.
It handles the material well, using a well written story, and the balls to have them be sisters, which is already better than Oreimo.
It doesn't dance around the fact that they're sisters, but that isn't necessarily a bad thing.
If you absolutely can't handle incest at all, then it isn't for you, but if you can, it just adds another layer to the plot, good or bad.
And lastly, I will commend it for advertising the 18+ patch right on the title screen
Even though it's a story based VN, I can't say that it isn't very honorable in the fact that it's a 100% free, safe to download right off of their blog patch, which adds the "plot" near the end of the story. (If you really want to skip through the entire thing.)


All in all
It was a 2 hour read for me (But that seems to be underaverage compared to the rest of the reviews)
Very heartfelt and sad due to how well written it was
Handles what it does well and naturally
Artstyle is smooth, and easy to look at
Soundtrack is appropriate and nice to listen to 
It doesn't have many branching routes, but that's only a minor complaint

I believe it's worth your time, and all of the 10 dollars that it costs
You'll love how moving it is, as it tells a tale of 2 forbidden lovers who don't kill themselves for once

This game starts off boring if I am gonna be honest. The story is kind of generic and not much really happens. Its not untill the mid point where things start to get off the ground. Zoey and Iris start to express their feelings more and more and you get invested more and more. ALSO, from here on out spoilers!

 I havent played each ending but I did get the together ending. I can safely say that this game isnt for everyone. If you want something like tell tale game where its heavily interactive, or a game in general well look else where. If you are looking for hentai to fap off too then again, look else where, there is one real sex scene after you download an 18+ patch but to be honest, with how invested you get with the characters I would safely say that as long as you play the game with context it wont feel like porn. This game also takes for fucking ever to complete. I spent about 6 hours on it *7 because I got bored with my friends and we skipped to the sex thing before I knew that there was a skip button* and yeah it is an advanced choose your own adenture book. I do however feel fuffilled with my purchase. I got really invested in the character and once I got to the ending I wanted to see it countinued, I wanted to know "ok now what?". That being said I felt like the ending was a bit predictable. I kept saying, "ha, no they wont go down that path, that would just be stupid and predictable.", but then they did. In short, you wake up from a nap to discover your dad has come and basically all your problems go away. Zoey left and Iris blames it on her dad, and then it cuts to years later when Iris sees zoey from far away, chases after her, confronts her, and basically its a happily ever after, of sorts. I feel like that it should have been a dream sequence, where Iris wakes up with Zoey returning, and they have to face the cruel reality of what they have done.   They run away, and in spite of them leaving everything behind, in spite of this being a hard choice they do it. It wouldn't be the happy ending everyone wanted, it wouldnt be a happy go lucky ending, these are two people running away from everything they know, love, and care about to be with someone they know, love, and care about. It would a harsh light on it, making it feel more like a story about taboo love between two sisters and not a happy go lucky romance novel. The other big issue with the game in my opinion was how the only characters we really saw were Iris and Zoey. I dont know if this was intentional but it kind of took things away from me. I know its just a novel in a game but when I see Zoey and Iris and then I am left just to imagine what everyone else looks like I feel like it was just a cheap and lazy method on saving some time/money. It also has an issue of repeating backgrounds, like they use 1 nightclub background 3 times through out the story and then they always are wearing the same clothes, like the school girl outfit I understand but their normal clothes are just the same over and over again, zoey wears a jack with a flannel tied around her waist and Iris wears a cute pink dress.  Lastly, I have to restate this, the opening is so boring. I honestly thought I made a mistake purchasing this at first, because in my mind I basically knew, ok theres gonna be sex, but what the fuck is this shit? Zoey seems like just a fucking punk girl trying to be cool and Iris was just an average marry sue, ok bascially normal anime/hentai bullshit? Then once it got past the first hour or 2 I was like, ok things are getting interesting. And after a while I forgot there was even a sex scene, which ,again, felt more dramatic then it did arousing. I feel like this game is a pretty good book but not really what most people would call a game. 

Overall, I would definetly buy a sequel to this, but I also would probably never replay this game more than once a year, maybe two, if that. Again, this is a book, not a game. The description made that clear. This also isnt hentai/porn, despite what it may seem. This also isn't a happy game, once something happy happens there is something that takes away from it, whethers its an outside source or an internal conflict problem with the character. That also is the reason the ending sucked because where as everything else was a balance of happy then crashing down with something sad or dramatic, the ending was happy, and go lucky. Overall, I give this a recomendation to those who dont mind just reading, but to those seeking a book/porn, look elsewhere.

30302118.review:
Wie viele andere Käufer wurde auch ich vom Thema des Spiels angelockt und habe spontan zugeschlagen. Meine Eindrücke:

Es handelt sich anscheinend um ein Visual Novel, man erlebt mehr eine interaktive Geschichte als ein Spiel im klassischen Sinne. Im Gegensatz zu herkömmlichen Point&Click Spielen wie Life Is Strange oder The Walking Dead bei denen man zumindest eingeschränkt eine Figur steuert, macht man hier nichts anderes als zu lesen und die Bilder auf sich wirken zu lassen. Nur gelegentlich muss eine Entscheidung getroffen werden, generell sind es aber weniger als ich erwartet habe. Auch fallen diese nicht so sehr ins Gewicht.

Der Soundtrack ist der Stimmung angepasst und wirklich gut, die Geschichte ist schön erzählt und die Zeichnungen der beiden Charaktere sind sehr schön anzusehen. Manchmal gibt es auch leicht animierte Szenen, gerade bei den interessanten Stellen ;)

Die Spielzeit ist bei mir mit ca. 3 Stunden in Ordnung, allerdings finde ich knapp 10€ als zu teuer. Wartet bis zu einem Sale und schlagt lieber dann zu. Hat man die Geschichte einmal erlebt, ist der Wiederspielwert wie bei all solchen Spielen eher gering, daran ändern auch zwei mögliche Enden sowie der jeweils alternative Weg nichts. Dennoch gibt es von mir eine Empfehlung, da ich trotz meiner bescheidenen Englischkenntnisse das Meiste gut verstanden habe und ich gut unterhalten wurde, es ist spannend weil man stets wissen möchte wie es weitergeht.

PS: Der 18+ Patch kann kostenlos heruntergeladen und installiert werden. Dies empfehle ich allen Spielern zu tun, denn Hand aufs Herz: Jeder hat sich das Spiel gekauft um das zu sehen :D

"그 꽃입에 입맞춤을" 는 모든 대사가 성우들의 더빙이 되어있었는데 그와달리 달리  "옥상위의  백합령씨"는 중요 장면에서만 더빙 기능이  있었던 것이 저에게는 큰 차이점들중 하나였습니다. 무엇보다 한국번역 프로그램이 있는지조차 저에게는 유무였고 영어를 번역해 가면서  (물론 떄로는 이래 짐작 해가면서ㅎ;) 스토리 진행을 했는데요, 이 게임 "LOVE RiBBON" 과 비교했을때 쉬웠구나 싶었습니다. "LOVE RIBBORN"에서 나오는 영어들은 제에게는 "옥탑방 백합령씨"에 비교했을때 조금더 '10대' 또는 '인터넷'에 올라오는 용어(표현법)들이 많이 보였습니다. 물론 저 보다 더 쉽게 이야기를 읽어 나가시는 분이 많을것이기에 그분들을 진심으로 존경합니다:) 

이 게임에는 더빙 성우가 없습니다. 지금 몇시간 동안 진행해 가면서 지루하지 않을까 고민 했었는데 , 그렇기 떄문에 게임에서 나오는 브금과 잔잔한 클릭 소리와 함께 캐릭터들의  표정 변화들을 볼수 있었던게 좋았던것 같습니다. 가끔 '리그 오브 레전드' 게임을 해보셨던 분들이라면 아시겠지만 오프닝 화면에서 플래시 애니메이션이 나오는데 그 비슷한 기법이 중요한 장면에서 사용 되어진게 보였습니다. 더빙이 없다보니 브금과 캐릭터의 표정 변화에 몰입다하 가끔 율동이 있는 화면 전게에 지루하지 않게 진행중입니다:) 가격대비 굉장희 만족스럽게 진행하고 있습니다. 저도 백합물을 좋아하고 관심있는 분이시라면 재밋게 하실거 같아요ㅎㅎ 추천해요!!

Razz’s art style just keeps getting better and better, it’s absolutely amazing on this visual novel! About the story, I was expecting something cliché, and I got something different. [spoiler]You expect the “they CAN be sisters, but in the end they’re not so it’s A-okay to date since they’re not blood related”… Well, they [i]are[/i] blood related. I was surprised by that fact, and specially by their dad’s reaction; no soap opera drama here like “NO, THIS CAN’T BE HAPPENING!”. Their dad actually wants to protect Iris, and does what he thinks it’s correct in order to help his daughter. Some people might say that kind of behavior isn’t “real”, that anyone would get angry. Well, some parents really would do ANYTHING to protect their child, despite what they’ve done. It was nice to see a different reaction here, and all those factors actually made me feel bad about Zoey and Iris…[/spoiler]

It all starts pretty cute, then you’re dragged by your a*ss to the depths of sadness. Also, the animation is not great, but it surely gives a certain charm to this VN.

8/10, would cry over sad lesbians again.

30096048.review:
[h1]Do yourself a favour and grab the 18+ patch for the full experience[/h1]

[b]Plot summary[/b]
Love ribbon is a story about how two long lost sisters finally meet, and how they come to terms about their own sexuality.[spoiler][i]towards each other.[/i][/spoiler] We have Iris and Zoey as the main leads in this visual novel ride, as they spend quality time with each other and slowly progress their [spoiler][i]saucy[/i][/spoiler] relationship.

[b]'Why should I check this game out?'[/b]
High school premise is nothing new here, but I must give credit to how the story in Love ribbon grounds itself within realistic expectations of society.  Most of the tension and drama that arises from this game really does help flesh out the personality and growth of the sisters quite well.  Animated CG's are one of the game's strong selling point[spoiler]([i]especially during 'playful' moments.[/i])[/spoiler]  Choice of music fits and is decent enough, tension is there when important scenes play. You get two different endings to pick from if you wanna explore a alternate ending.

[b]'Should I buy this game?'[/b]
This is kinda tricky to answer, but if you are a fan of girlxgirl relationships and are ok with a short contained stories, consider buying Love ribbon and supporting the developer [i](even better if it goes on sale!)[/i] Might not appeal to everyone, but hey you clicked on this for the girls amrite :^)

[spoiler]P.S Stay tuned after the credits for a tiny epilogue and buttstuff/10 action :D[/spoiler]
